data.title: Delectable Dining - right here in Lafayette!
data.text: We were thrilled to hear Parkside Seafood House & Oyster Bar has reopened! Thank you to the new owner for keeping seafood in town. We had a delicious dinner - fried oysters, clam chowder (not pasty at all), Jerked Halibut, and Shrimp with cheesy grits (uploading photos of all). Portions are generous and prices are in line with quality seafood. You won't be disappointed!! Such a cozy atmosphere and very clean as well.

data.title: New owner, same great food
data.text: I was disappointed to see that Parkside had closed its doors last spring. It is open once again under new management that fortunately kept all that was good about this establishment. Styled very modern and cleanly, it is a relaxed dining atmosphere with a nice selection of mainly seafood entrees. What I really liked were the pairings of each menu item with an interesting vegetable and starch offering. Flavors were well matched, and creative. A fun experienc

data.title: Outstanding---a great find in the Purdue area!!
data.text: I've tried many places around Purdue  and this place is THE BEST.  Not cheap, but worth it if you are looking for great service, the owner in the place, and good seafood. They have other items but seafood is their focus. New owner is reviving this spot which has a Cape Cod feel and right across from a park. In a residential area so it feels homey. Fresh seafood was a surprise, its Lafayette. Good wine list.

data.title: Fabulous!!
data.text: Arrived without reservation, greeted pleasantly. Seated almost immediately. Small quaint, lovely. Food was spectacular, had King crab legs, Clam Chowder, Salmon, Crab Cakes. We all shared. Everything was better than expected. Owner came to table to make sure we were happy. Even the salad was special!

data.title: Under new ownership, just as excellent as before!
data.text:
I reviewed this after our anniversary dinner in 2015, and it was great then. It closed for a few months this year as it changed ownership, and we were glad it reopened, but wondered if it would still measure up. We returned for this year's anniversary dinner and were pleased to find it was just as good as before.

I had noted on our reservation that this was an anniversary dinner, and they printed us menus that wished us a happy anniversary, a nice little touch. We ordered the smoked platter appetizer and everything was delicious. I had the chili rubbed snapper, my wife enjoyed crab cakes, and both were well prepared. Desserts were creme brulee and key lime pie, both light and creamy and very tasty.

Service was friendly and efficient, without every being intrusive. Overall, the restaurant was every bit as good as it was before it changed hands. Glad to have it back!

data.title: Good, but could be even better
data.text:
I have visited Parkside twice in the past year. It is certainly a great addition to the Lafayette dining scene. Lots of things you just can't get anywhere else near Lafayette.

The food was once really good and the other time just okay. Service was great once and not too good the other time. Being one of three tables in the restaurant (especially of that size) getting a refill should never be an issue. 

I will return but do hope they are more consistent. Definitely recommend to try out to anyone living in or visiting Lafayette!

data.title: Great seafood
data.text: This restaurant was an awesome addition for Lafayette. The seafood really is on par with a coastal city. Large beer and wine selection. Always have great meals here.

data.title: Underwhelmed and Overpriced
data.text:
My wife and I have tried Parkside twice now. Both times we came away underwhelmed. The first time we went our entrees came out at different times because one of the entrees had been taken to another table. No concern from the management until I made it an issue for them. The food was okay, but not worth the price. 

The second time we went the service was fine. The fish was over cooked and very dry and tough. I had the red snapper and I can honestly say it was the first time I have ever had to cut my fish with a knife. 

Now, the bright spot both times were the oysters. They were the one saving grace. They were fantastic. If ever do return it will be purely for the oysters.

data.title: Great food & service, but PRICEY
data.text: I had a night to myself & decided to treat myself & try this out.  Food was lovely, fresh, tasty, and the service could not have been better -- frequently not the case for a solo diner!  That said, the side garnish of rice & vegetables of the sweet & sour shrimp was on the skimpy side.  And be prepared: you do pay for that freshness and service!  a salad, sweet & sour shrimp, and a nice glass of wine was over $50 with tip.

data.title: Are we really in Lafayette?
data.text: Wow!  Visited Parkside Seafood House for the first time last week and could not believe we were in Indiana.  The seafood was fresh and really delicious.  We shared the shrimp cocktail which had a really spicy sauce.  My husband had a great chopped Ceasar salad and I had an outstanding bowl of clam chowder.  Our entrees were the shrimp and the salmon both of which were lovely.  Had the key lime pie for dessert...so yummy.  We even got a great bottle of wine.  Our server was wonderful!  Thanks for a memorable evening.

data.title: Great food, period.
data.text:
I've been several times with friends and family, and everyone has been delighted with the setting, service, and decor. It's a charming little place done in understated nautical decor, and serving the freshest seafood you can get in the Midwest outside of Chicago -- literally. The owner got on the delivery schedule with high end restaurants that deliver fresh seafood to other major locations.

This also means you're going to pay extra. HOWEVER, you can get fresh clams on the halfshell, chosen off of a tasting menu with 4-5 offered daily, and a seafood tower like the kind you would only otherwise see on a coastline. It's really something.

data.title: Trying to accommodate my seafood loving friends
data.text: I wanted to like this place for my friends sake even though I don't care much for seafood. I checked online and saw that they also served one meat option (a $30 filet), so I thought I could easily have a nice meal. The night we went, the meat option was instead a New York strip steak and it was $50! It was of very poor quality, with bone, gristle and a ring of fat around the edge. The steak was supposedly dry-aged but tasted no better than anything you can buy at a regular grocery store. And did I mention it was $50? Mashed potatoes along with it were cold and the asparagus on top was extremely overcooked. Overall, not at all impressive. I won't be back.

data.title: Small place, big price, delicious food!
data.text: Took my sister for her birthday so we splurged with appetizer, salad, entree, wine, and dessert.  All the food was great, but especially loved the dessert.  We chose the Creme Brûlée and it was perfection!  We both had shrimp appetizer but if you like oysters you might enjoy their oyster bar.  I had delicious salmon and my sister enjoyed the sea bass. The menu changes frequently depending on the availability of fresh fish available.  I recommend you make reservations as the place is small and has limited seating. It is also somewhat pricey.  I paid over $120.00 for the evening.  The menu was available online so knew and planned for the expense.  This cost did not include the Creme Brûlée both of us enjoyed it gratis as it was provided for the Birthday Girl!

data.title: really expensive
data.text: This place is very pricey for the food.  Although it has some good fish dishes but plan to pay a high price. Very small place and it is nice once you are seated. Servers are great and very helpful. Try it   I have been 2 times and 1 time they canceled my reservation ( a birthday celebration) 4 hrs before.

data.title: Nice ambiance, but overpriced
data.text: I am a fish eater (no beef, poultry, or pork) and have lived on the East Coast and know good seafood. This is not it. The wine selection is excellent, but the pours are *very* small and incredibly overpriced. The decor is beachy, breezy and inviting. Staff is friendly. Just way too expensive for the quality and portion size. We did really love the homemade Key Lime Pie for dessert (top notch).

data.title: My Favorite
data.text: It is hard to get seafood in the midwest, let alone in a super cute historic building with great service. I have never had a bad experience here for special occasions or casual. It is small, so generally you do want reservations. Though in warmer months the outdoor seating helps capacity. I love raw oysters and you can pick your variety a la carte. Half Price Oysters (from4-6) and half price bottles of wine (all night) on Wednesdays is great for a girls' night light gathering with friends.

data.title: Who Knew
data.text:
I had no idea this restaurant existed (it is tucked away on the residential side of a street).  This seafood restaurant is worth finding!

Our server selected three varieties of oyesters in our dozen.  This allowed us to experience the different flavors and textures.  They were all fresh.

Our entrees were welI presented and flavorful.  Try the halibut cheeks for a unique flavor and texture.

data.title: Very nice..
data.text:
You won't be disappointed. Some reviewers, spoke of the acoustics, we didn't have any of that and they were pretty full. It's a small place, about 15 tables with a family style, long table in a different area. Food was well prepared, fresh and the quality was great. We had, lobster Mac n cheese, oysters on the half shell, filet and lobster ( or surf and turf to some), shrimp cocktail, and a ceaser salad. Very good all the way around. 

Service was very good and attentive and the wine list is extensive. There is an up and coming  5 course dinner with wine pairings at the end of the month, if we were here, we would definitely go.

data.title: An unexpected treasure
data.text: We recently had dinner here with our son. He has been at Purdue for 2 1/2 years and we have always found restaurant options to be limited, so we were pleased to find this place. It is off the main drag, in a quiet neighborhood in what appears to be an old house. The interior reminded us of many seafood placed we have visited in Maine and we thought it was really cute. It is very quiet and the crowd was pretty much older people, not a college hangout. Our waitress was very attentive and prompt. The menu has several choices. We started out with the cold platter which we devoured quickly. It is very good! My husband had the lobster roll which he loved. My son and I had the scallops and I would have to say we wouldn't order them again. You get 6 fair sized scallops, but they are served in a spicy tomatilla sauce that is way, way too spicy and totally overpowers the scallops. We tried to clean the sauce off, but it was a no go. Neither one of us could finish the scallops because of how hot they are. The rice and broccoli were fine. For desert my son had the milk and cookies, which were fine and I had the crème brulee, which was unremarkable. Overall, it was a very pleasant dining experience and we will be back in the future.

data.title: Wanted it to be better.
data.text:
The service was excellent.
The Caesar salad was good.
The Key Lime pie was excellent.
The crab legs and shrimp were not good.
The lobster tail was not good at all.
I am not sure how you can mess up shellfish.   It's always frozen when delivered to the restaurant.   It just wasn't high quality.
